alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 01 at 6:20AM EST until March 02 at 7:04AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers... Ohio River at Cincinnati. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Cincinnati. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 51.0 feet, Water begins to cover more areas of Kellogg Avenue from east of Delta Avenue upstream to near Coney Island to near Eight Mile Road. Parts of Humbert Avenue in the East End of Cincinnati also begin to flood. Most of Public Landing becomes flooded, as well as Riverside Park off River Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 50.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 41.3 feet Thursday afternoon. - Action stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood stage is 52.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
